name: latently
content:
Add to word list

in a way that is present but needs particular conditions to become active, obvious, or completely developed: The virus resides latently in B cells in most adult animals. The narrator is a jaded yet latently romantic middle-aged observer.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is not easy to find latently creative people who will blossom in middle age.This prejudice is not necessarily vocalized, but is instead latently expressed by the media and popular culture.Ultimately we're going to have to develop specific strategies aimed at targeting these latently infected cells.
